subject: Russ Mitchell: Coping With The Virginia Tech Tragedy

April 18, 
      2007
 
On 
      this morning's special edition of The Early Show, CBS News 
      correspondent Sharyn Alfonsi brought us the latest 
      developments on the Virginia Tech tragedy from 
      Blacksburg, 
      Va.

 
Former 
      classmate Sara Steven told us what she remembers about the man behind the 
      murders. 
 
Harry 
      attended last night's vigil and walked us through a 
      powerful night of mourning. 
 
As always, chief 
      Washington correspondent Bob 
      Schieffer joined us with insight into the 
      issue of gun control. 
 
In today's 
      HealthWatch, I spoke to Dr. Cynthia Pfeffer, the clinical director of the 
      Child Bereavement Program at New 
      York
Presbyterian
Hospital. She gave us 
      advice on how 
      to help your children make sense of the shootings. 
      
 
Tom 
      Brown, Virginia Tech's senior associate dean of students, joined us to 
      share with us what the university is doing to help the students, staff, 
      and their families deal with this tragedy. 
 
Please join us 
      tomorrow as our coverage of the Virginia tech massacre 
      continues. We will take an in-depth look at how students are coming 
      together in the face of tragedy. Or visit CBSNews.com any time for the 
      latest.

Russ 
      MitchellEarlyShow@cbs.com
